Obesity is the condition of having an abnormally high amount of body fat. It is a medical condition that occurs when a person’s body mass index (BMI) is greater than or equal to 30.
Obesity is a major risk factor for many diseases, including diabetes, cardiovascular disease, and some types of cancer. It can also lead to other health problems such as high blood pressure, sleep apnea, and osteoarthritis.
